feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [dweeves/magmi] Magmi XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) was discovered in Magmi 0.7.22. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient filtration of user-supplied data (prefix) passed to the magmi-git-master/magmi/web/ajax_gettime.php URL. An attacker could execute arbitrary HTML and script code in a browser in the context of the vulnerable website.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-7391
  • https://github.com/dweeves/magmi-git/issues/522
  • https://github.com/dweeves/magmi-git/pull/525
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210125191718/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97311
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r8vh-cm9f-rc29

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Craft CMS before 2.6.2974 allows XSS attacks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-8052
  • https://craftcms.com/changelog#2-6-2974
  • https://twitter.com/CraftCMS/status/855535309878112256
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xv5f-2997-qhrq

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Craft CMS before 2.6.2982 allows for a potential XSS attack vector by uploading a malicious SVG file.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-9516
  • https://craftcms.com/changelog#2-6-2982
  • https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/142851/Craft-CMS-2.6-Cross-Site-Scripting-File-Upload.html
  • https://twitter.com/CraftCMS/status/872599894912937984
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42143/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6pvw-hh48-jx7p

entry.title: [bolt/bolt] Bolt CMS Stored XSS
entry.content:
Bolt CMS 3.2.14 allows stored XSS by uploading an SVG document with a "Content-Type: image/svg+xml" header.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-11127
  • https://websecnerd.blogspot.in/2017/07/bolt-cms-3.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqxc-w9vw-3hp5

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Moodle 3.x, XSS can occur via evidence of prior learning.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-2644
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=349421
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/ac40d8b589820929fe4201a3f0640414e2b9dabd
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124004851/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96979
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210227004858/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038174
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-93gj-rg98-h7mm

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Craft CMS before 2.6.2976 allows XSS attacks because an array returned by HttpRequestService::getSegments() and getActionSegments() need not be zero-based. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-8052.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-8384
  • https://craftcms.com/changelog#2-6-2976
  • https://twitter.com/CraftCMS/status/857743080224473088
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9mcw-mwxv-grwj

entry.title: [yiisoft/yii2] Yii Framework Reflected XSS
entry.content:
Reflected Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Yii Framework before 2.0.11, when development mode is used, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted request data that is mishandled on the debug-mode exception screen.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-7271
  • https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/13401
  • https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/97171a0db7cda0a49931ee0c3b998ef50bd06756
  • http://www.yiiframework.com/news/123/yii-2-0-11-is-released/
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210125191138/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97167
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4xh9-5vh8-3p58

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM 4.0.4 has XSS in doli/societe/list.php via the sall parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-7887
  • https://www.foxmole.com/advisories/foxmole-2017-02-23.txt
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x2fq-gq6c-hp44

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM SQLi
entry.content:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM before 5.0.3 is vulnerable to a SQL injection in user/index.php (search_supervisor and search_statut parameters).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-9435
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/70636cc59ffa1ffbc0ce3dba315d7d9b837aad04
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/blob/develop/ChangeLog
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v3m8-7h3p-6j5m

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM Unsafe File Upload Vulnerability
entry.content:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM 5.0.3 and prior allows low-privilege users to upload files of dangerous types, which can result in arbitrary code execution within the context of the vulnerable application.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-9840
  • https://www.wizlynxgroup.com/security-research-advisories/vuln/WLX-2017-009
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cwgm-qw8v-hrrg

entry.title: [admidio/admidio] admidio CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
admidio 3.2.8 has CSRF in adm_program/modules/members/members_function.php with an impact of deleting arbitrary user accounts.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-8382
  • https://github.com/Admidio/admidio/issues/612
  • https://github.com/faizzaidi/Admidio-3.2.8-CSRF-POC-by-Provensec-llc
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/42005/
  • http://en.0day.today/exploit/27771
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c4v8-2hg8-jv77

entry.title: [laravel/framework] Laravel Sensitive Data Exposure
entry.content:
Laravel before 5.5.10 mishandles the remember_me token verification process because DatabaseUserProvider does not have constant-time token comparison.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14775
  • https://github.com/laravel/framework/pull/21320
  • https://github.com/laravel/framework/releases/tag/v5.5.10
  • https://laravel-news.com/laravel-v5-5-11
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c2v7-j5gq-wcq4

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
SilverStripe CMS before 3.6.1 has XSS via an SVG document that is mishandled by (1) the Insert Media option in the content editor or (2) an admin/assets/add pathname, as demonstrated by the admin/pages/edit/EditorToolbar/MediaForm/field/AssetUploadField/upload URI, aka issue SS-2017-017.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14498
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/25b77a2ff8deabe8e8894002b9a5647eaec27b0a
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-installer/commit/c25478bef75cc5482852e80a1fa6f1f0e6460e39
  • https://docs.silverstripe.org/en/3/changelogs/3.6.1
  • http://lists.openwall.net/full-disclosure/2017/09/14/2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j696-6m57-mcrv

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure
entry.content:
In Moodle 3.x, various course reports allow teachers to view details about users in the groups they can't access.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12157
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=358586
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/85b531e8beae3497ec2075e07e59c581fccb317c
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124103841/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100848
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gw95-48xq-gqf9

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Moodle 3.x has XSS in the contact form on the "non-respondents" page in non-anonymous feedback.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12156
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=358585
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/a39d2976fe5e91da7a28a8512d5b94d4a27067b8
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124104026/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100867
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7mfw-g8x4-rq2w
